Deficiency Narrative: Emergency evacuation plan was not posted in 3 of the 4 areas.
During the walkthrough of the operation multiple safety hazards were identified to include walkways, mold on an exterior walls and glass shards on the outside back deck.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted and confirmed safety concerns had been addressed.

Deficiency Narrative: Emergency Evacuation Diagram was found to not have all the required information.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted and confirmed new evacuation plans had been posted

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough the showers in the residential areas were found to be without warm and hot water.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted and confirmed all restrooms had hot water available.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing four out of four records reviewed did not have required educational plans.
Correction Narrative:
Operation requested additional time to complete the updated form as corporate is in the process of reviewing the changes. A checklist is being created to ensure that all required information is listed on the service plans. Comply by date 3/31/25.

Operation provided an updated Master Treatment Plan that will be implemented.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was not taken to a follow up appointment pertaining to an injury.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from operation on 4/11/25 advising that RTC Supervisors will be responsible for scheduling all medical appointments with the transportation department. Effective Date 3/20/25.
-Training on the new process was provided to all staff on 4/30/25 and a sign in sheet was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation has not obtained required yearly fire inspection.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided completed fire inspection on 2/27/25.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care was injured during an unnecessary restraint when excessive physical force was used.
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed that additional training had been completed regarding Understanding the Risks of Disengagements and Restrictive Interventions.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff did not provide immediate care or treatment after seeing child was injured and unresponsive.
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed that additional training had been received regarding Rapid Response Procedures.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was found deficient as part of a DFPS Investigation.
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed that additional training was received regarding Understanding Trauma and the impact on patient care

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member administered an unnecessary restraint to get a child to comply.
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed that additional training had been completed regarding Understanding the Risks of Disengagements and Restrictive Interventions.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed that a child did not receive their prescription medications for two days.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/23/24, compliance plan received from operation stating Policy #PHR-127 MEDICATION ERRORS/ ADVERSE DRUG EVENTS will be reviewed with current nursing staff 12/23/24 and a signed acknowledgment forms will be required and placed in the appropriate HR file.

An additional Nursing Supervisor was added to the RTC schedule beginning 12/16/24. This will ensure comprehensive oversight and guidance for nursing staff as well as direct care staff 7 days a week.

Nursing Supervisor will be able to oversee that procedures regarding medication administration, documentation, and storage will be consistently implemented.

Sign in sheets regarding additional training provided and meeting notes were received on 12/27/24.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed by operation staff and a child that medication was kept in a child's backpack and not in a locked container.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/23/24, compliance plan received by operation stating Policy #PHR-167 NURSING UNIT INSPECTION FORMS will be reviewed with current nursing staff 12/23/24 and a signed acknowledgment forms will be required and placed in the appropriate HR file.

An additional Nursing Supervisor was added to the RTC schedule beginning 12/16/24. This will ensure comprehensive oversight and guidance for nursing staff as well as direct care staff 7 days a week.
Nursing Supervisor will be able to oversee that procedures regarding medication administration, documentation, and storage will be consistently implemented.

Sign in sheets regarding additional training provided and meeting notes were received on 12/27/24.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was denied access to a bible.
Correction Narrative: On 12/23/24, compliance plan received by operation stating Bibles have been placed in the nurses station for all RTC residents to utilize. This information has been added to the RTC resident handbook as of 12/19/24.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was told that they should not smile because they should not be happy to be at the operation.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/23/24, compliance plan received by operation stating LCCA reviewed policy on prohibitive methods and appropriate disciplinary measures for RTC on 11/26/24 and ongoing education for staff not present. 

RTC Nursing Supervisors will ensure any pool or PRN staff working on RTC receive this information at the beginning of their shift. This will be documented in there HR file.

New employees will receive a copy of Prohibitive Methods during their shadowing, prior to being in ratio on RTC. 

This information will be reviewed at monthly RTC staff meeting every January and July. RTC Director will be responsible for ensuring this process is adhered to and documented for licensing review upon request.

Sign in sheets regarding additional training provided and meeting notes were received on 12/27/24.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed that a caregiver threatened to deny a child hygiene time if they did not comply.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/17/2024, compliance plan was received from operation via email. 

LCCA reviewed policy on prohibitive methods and appropriate disciplinary measures for RTC on 11/26/24 and ongoing education for staff not present. Attached is the policy and sign in sheet of acknowledgment.

RTC Nursing Supervisors will ensure any pool or PRN staff working on RTC receive this information at the beginning of their shift. This will be documented in there HR file.

New employees will receive a copy of Prohibitive Methods during their shadowing prior to being in ratio on RTC. This information will be reviewed at monthly RTC staff meeting every January and July. RTC Director will be responsible for ensuring this process is adhered to and documented for licensing review upon request.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff were unaware that a child was in the shower leading to a maintenance worker walking in on the child while they were using the bathroom.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/17/24, compliance plan received via email from operation. 

LCCA reviewed supervision expectations with RTC staff at the staff meeting on 11/20/24 and ongoing for staff not able to attend. Attached is the handout received by staff and the meeting sign in sheet.

As of 10/25/24 staff were notified the new UHS policy requiring directors, one camera or one in person audit per day, looking for noncompliance of supervision. Staff were also made aware of what active supervision is, and what the follow-up Actions would be from the training department as well as the HR department. This information has been in attached to this email.

Deficiency Narrative: Allegations involving inappropriate sexual comments made by a staff member were not reported timely to Licensing.
Correction Narrative: Operation reported allegations to hotline and advised that a comprehensive review of the standard for reporting serious incidents, conducted by the RTC director, will mitigate the risk of future occurrences.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff supervising children in care did not have active background checks.
Correction Narrative: Operation advised that two full time employees from the acute facility were moved to work on the Lavaca Unit after the unit had two full time staff members call in for their shift. The two employees that were present during the unannounced survey had background checks run at their time of hire but because they were employees of the acute facility, had been deactivated in the system in July 2024. The current list of active employees in the system has been reviewed and additional full-time weekend staff from the acute facility have been added for emergency situations or when there are coverage needs due to multiple, unexpected RTC staff outages. The list of employees has been shared with the Staffing Coordinator, the Overnight, and the Weekend Nursing Supervisors to ensure that only staff with confirmed background checks work on the RTC units.

Deficiency Narrative: Outdoor area in Lavaca Unit had animal feces, a cracked plastic weight stand and broken wooden bench head rest.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted and areas were clean and free of hazards. Operation implemented new checklist to include outdoor furniture maintance and animal feces.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not have yearly fire inspection conducted timely.
Lavaca Unit had 3 staff for 16 children in care.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted and ratio was in compliance.Two staff interviewed confirmed that additional training was provided regarding ratio requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: Date of admission is not present in the annual summary log.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation advising that the Annual Elopement Log for Laurel Ridge was modified to include the time of the incident along with the admission date. A copy of the modified log was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Time of the incidents listed in the annual log is not present.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation advising that the Annual Elopement Log for Laurel Ridge was modified to include the time of the incident along with the admission date. A copy of the modified log was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: During an interview with former staff member, it was stated they have not been employed by the operation since 10/17/2023. The staff member's background is showing active as of 11/13/2023.
Correction Narrative:
Compliance plan received via email from operation:
1 .This finding was discussed with the Assistant Director of Human Resources, who handles the TDFPS background verifications.
2.Upon notification that an employee is terminating employment, an electronic personnel action form is completed, which sends a notification to the Director of Human Resources for approval. Once the approval for termination has been given by the Director of Human Resources, an automated email gets sent to the payroll system and the Human Resources Assistant to deactivate the employee.
3.A process was put in place on November 17, 2023, in which a weekly report for RTC employee terminations will be run each Friday by the Assistant Director of Human Resources to verify that any employee that has left LRTC employment in the past week has been deactivated by the HR assistant, to include removing them from the TDFPS background check list.
4.The Assistant Director of Human Resources will send the LCCA a monthly report of all RTC terminations and the date they were deactivated in the TDFPS.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not have a documented Child Care Policy.
Correction Narrative: Email received from administrative staff, on 10/11/23 with attached Childcare Policy for the operation. Policy provided met all the standard requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were told they would be put in Seclusion for not obeying directives given by staff memer.
Correction Narrative: Staff member involved in incident is no longer employed at the operation. All remaining staff attended additional training on appropriate discipline.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was determined that caregivers are caring for more than five children with treatment services at a time.
Correction Narrative:
Email received on 3/13/23 from operation with compliance plan:

1. Staffing for the RTC will be reviewed by the Nursing Supervisor and/or the Staffing Coordinator prior to the start of each shift.
2.The one staff to five patients staffing ratio (during waking hours) will be visually verified at random times throughout the shift by the Program Director and/or Nursing Supervisors.
3.Staffing will be adjusted throughout the shift as needed due to admissions/discharges and/or off ground passes or activities.
4.The Program Director, RTC therapists, and/or Nursing Supervisors may be needed at times throughout the day to assist with maintaining staffing ratio compliance.
5.Staffing rosters will be reviewed for compliance daily by the LCCA.
6.The Staffing Coordinator will be responsible for storage of all reviewed staffing logs.

In person follow-up also conducted on 3/28/23. Ratio was reviewed and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was determined that caregivers yelled directly at children in care.
Correction Narrative:
-Email received on 3/13/23 from the operation with the following information:

The GRO Subchapter M-Discipline and Punishment and standard 5748.2307, 'VVhat other methods of punishment are prohibited?" was reviewed with staff.
2.Staff were trained by the Program Director and RTC Nursing Supervisor on the requirements of disciplinary measures in residential care.
3. Attached training/sign-in roster was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was determined a caregiver did not demonstrate prudent judgement when they failed to redirect inappropriate comments made towards them from a child in care.
Correction Narrative:
Email received on 3/13/23 from Operation with the following plan: 
1.The staff member cited in this investigation will be removed from the RTC unit for 30 days.
2.The staff member cited in this investigation will be required to complete two assigned trainings, presented by Valerie Devereaux, RN, DNP, MSN, Vice President of Nursing, United Health Services, before being allowed to return to the RTC program:
Therapeutic Nurse-Patient Relationships
Therapeutic Milieu and Communication
3.Upon return to the RTC program, the staff member cited in this investigation will meet weekly for 90 days with the RTC Nursing Supervisor to discuss patient care/therapeutic milieu issues.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not report a serious incident to licensing involving inappropriate behaviors between children in care.
Correction Narrative:
1 . All RTC direct care staff and therapists were educated by the RTC Director of Clinical Services and RTC Nursing Director on the GRO Standard "When must I report and document a serious incident?"
2.	Training included definitions of the types of serious incidents that the facility is required to report: substantial physical injury or critical illness; allegations of abuse neglect or exploitation of a child; physical abuse committed by a child against a child; and, sexual abuse committed by a child against another child.
This is not an inclusive list of serious incidents that require reporting.
3.	Training included how to make a direct report of a serious incident or occurrence to TDPFS by phone or online through the Texas Abuse and Neglect Hotline.
4.	Training included reviewing the GRO Standard 5748.31 1 "How must I document a serious incident?" Training included discussion of what information needs to be included as part of the investigative process.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon review of background checks, it was found that staff statuses for one person are not accurate.
Correction Narrative: Compliant: Follow-up inspection was conducted on 5/20/22; CAP was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon inspection, it was observed that medications counted did not match the amount recorded in the medciation log.
Correction Narrative: Compliant: Follow-up inspection was conducted on 5/20/22; CAP was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon inspection, it was found that child's rights provided to children are missing many of the rights as provided by the standards.
Correction Narrative: Compliant: Follow-up inspection was conducted on 5/20/22; CAP was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Severe weather drills are not being conducted every six months.
Correction Narrative: Compliant: Follow-up inspection was conducted on 5/20/22; CAP was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not have the required pre-service training hours regarding EBI or trauma informed care.
Correction Narrative:
1. All RTC staff completed the two hour training classes and have course completion certificates in the föllowihg areas:
a.Trauma and Trauma-informed Care: An Introductory Training Provided by DFPS
b.Need for Normalcy Training provided by DFPS
2.All RTC staff completed an additional 4 hours of Milieu Management and Crisis Intervention Training with the facilities Nurse Educator and CPI Instructors.
a.Staff completing training signed an acknowledgment that they agree to provide a positive and safe environment by using the milieu management and crisis intervention techniques learned in training.
b.See attached sign in rosters and copy of blank acknowledgement
3.Trauma Informed Care, Normalcy, and the four hour Milieu Management and
Crisis Intervention training have been added to the New Employee Orientation. 

4. All training certificates and acknowledgements have been placed in the individual's training files in Human Resources, as well as a copy kept in the
LCCA's office.
5. An annual training calendar was developed to include the required elements for GRO standard 748.947(a) and 748.945(2).
6. Additional training will be provided by the Medical Director, the Program Director and the Nursing Director at mandatory, monthly meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff were aware of allegations made by child in care regarding alleged inappropriate touching from a staff member. Staff were aware of the outcry and did not report to licensing.
Correction Narrative: 05/03/21, email received from operation staff with compliance plan to the following citation. Operation staff reviewed reporting A/N and focused the training on minimum standards for GRO; when must I report and document serious incident. This was completed with full time staff and PRN RTC therapists. Operation also completed Reporting A/N training in their annual training completed on 04/26/21. Logs were provided of all staff who were present and completed this training. Compliance has been met.

Deficiency Narrative: Four child records were reviewed. Three of the four did not show orientation was completed timely with the child. Two records did not have the orientation packet and one was not completed as child was at operation for more than 7 days.
Correction Narrative: 03/08/21, compliance plan was provided through email. Operation has stated orientation process has been overhauled and the staff/clinical team completed training on 1/28/21 regarding the new process to ensure all patients are adequately oriented into their units in a timely fashion. Plan also completed the new process which is located in Share Point. RTC director will conduct new patient audits to ensure the orientation packets have been reviewed, understood and signed.
